com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenObjectShapeBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectBase
      • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectShapeBase
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpenObjectLine, SpenObjectShape

    public class SpenObjectShapeBase
extends SpenObjectBase
    Base class of the shape category.
    ObjectShapeBase can not be used by itself.
    Application can set/get the some effect and connection information.

    ObjectShapeBase is a base class of ObjectShape and ObjectLine.
    It supports connection between two ObjectShapeBase objects. An ObjectShapeBase object can connect to the other ObjectShapeBase object.
    Exactly, a connection point can connect to a connection point of the other object. After it connect to other object, it influences other object when it moves, resizes or scales. It depends on an implementation which attributes are influenced by these changes.
    It can also select which visual effect will be applied. There are various effects. Line color, line style.

    Since:
    4.0.0

      • setConnectionMode

        public void setConnectionMode(int mode)
        Set the connection mode.

        Each object has its own connection points. Each connection point has a position information and object lists which is connected. Generally speaking, if two objects are connected to each other, it means their "connection points" are connected each other. The connected connection points usually should have same connection information.

        Let's assume there are a rectangle shape and a line.
        A rectangle shape has four connection points on its four side. Let's call theme as "A", "B", "C", "D".
        A line has two connection points on its both edge. Let's call them as "a", "b".
        Now connect two objects. At this time, "A" would connect to "a". "A" and "a" would locate at same position.
        The "a" which is connected to "A" would registered to the object list of "A" and vice versa.
        Let's move the rectangle shape to another place. As the object moves, the connection point "A" should move to corresponding position.
        At time, if we check the connection information, we can find they are connected each other but the position is different.
        That is, the integrity of connection information is broken.

        Connection mode determines how we fix this problem. SPen supports below two modes.

        Tightly Coupled Mode : This mode always try to keep the integrity of connection information. Let's see above example again. If "a" follows "A", the integrity will be kept. If "a" doesn't want to move its position, "a" can decide to disconnect from "A". Although the position is different from each other, it's not a problem because they are disconnected.

        Loosely Coupled Mode : This mode never try to keep the integrity of connection information. They can be in connected even they locate at different position.

        Two modes have different event propagation mechanism.

        In tightly coupled mode, when "A" is changed, the event that it is changed propagates to "a". So "a" can decide it should follow "A" or disconnect from "A". Beside this, in loosely coupled mode, when "A" is changed, the event that it is changed never propagates to "a". Now "a" doesn't know what happens to "A", "a" doesn't do anything. Integrity would be broken.

        When the mode is changed from loosely coupled mode to tightly coupled mode, because the integrity in loosely coupled mode can be broken, it should recover the integrity.
        It finds all of the connection points which have integrity problem and reports them to connected objects.

        When it does group level operation, the loosely coupled mode can be useful. If we moves more than two connected objects, a move command would generate various intermediate event which affect connected object. These changes can make side effect to following original move command. To prevent this problem, we can use loosely coupled mode.

        Parameters:
        mode - Connection mode to set. It can be CONNECTION_MODE_TIGHTLY_COUPLED or CONNECTION_MODE_LOOSELY_COUPLED.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the mode is not CONNECTION_MODE_TIGHTLY_COUPLED or CONNECTION_MODE_LOOSELY_COUPLED.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        getConnectionMode()

      • getConnectionMode

        public int getConnectionMode()
        Get current connection mode.
        Returns:

        See Also:
